```{r}

# https://github.com/caseymm/img2geojson

# load geoJSON file
lylat_JSON <- st_read("Lylat.geojson")
```

```{r}
# make crude map
lylat_JSON |>
  ggplot() +
  geom_sf(aes(fill = id))

lat_min <- 36
lat_max <- 46
long_min <- -125
long_max <- -105
```


```{r}
# make map
# https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64602323/read-geojson-file-using-sf-library
# https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51255832/how-to-add-an-image-on-ggplot-background-not-the-panel
# https://stock.adobe.com/images/deep-space-high-definition-star-field-background-starry-outer-space-background-texture-colorful-starry-night-sky-outer-space-background/275024742
foreground <- lylat_JSON |>
  ggplot() +
  ggpubr::background_image(png::readPNG("space_background.png")) +
  geom_sf(aes(fill = id)) +
  labs(title = "",
       subtitle = "",
       caption = "",
       x = "", y = "") +
  # xlim(long_min, long_max) +
  # ylim(lat_min, lat_max) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white"),
        panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white"),
        plot.title = element_text(color = "#2ca25f", face = "bold",
                                  size = 48, hjust = 0.5),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(color = "#2ca25f",
                                  size = 36, hjust = 0.5),
        plot.caption = element_text(color = "#2ca25f",
                                  size = 24, hjust = 0.5))

## add background
# ggimage::ggbackground(foreground, "space_background.png")
```
